definitions.definition: A mythological bird, said to be the only one of its kind, which lives for 500 years and then dies by burning to ashes on a pyre of its own making, ignited by the sun. It then arises anew from the ashes.
Anything that is reborn after apparently being destroyed.
definitions.example: Astronomers believe planets might form in this dead star's disk, like the mythical Phoenix rising up out of the ashes.

definitions.definition: A mythological Chinese chimerical bird whose physical body symbolizes the six celestial bodies.
A Greek silver coin used briefly from 1828 to 1832, divided into 100 lepta.
